title: Blueberry Cornflake Crisp
ingredients: ⅔cup firmly packed (147g) plus ½ cup (110g) light brown sugar
directions: 2. In a large bowl, combine 6 cups blueberries, ½ cup brown sugar, 3 tablespoons flour, and ½ teaspoon salt. Zest half a lemon into the bowl, then squeeze in the juice of the whole lemon (catch seeds). Toss to combine. Transfer to an 8×8-inch baking dish or cast-iron skillet.

3. In the same bowl, mix 1 teaspoon cardamom, 1½ cups cornflakes, 1¼ cups flour, ⅔ cup brown sugar, and ½ teaspoon salt. Cut ½ cup cold butter into ½-inch pieces and mix in with your hands until clumpy. It’s okay if some cornflakes get crushed.
4. Spread the topping evenly over the blueberries, forming some larger clumps as you go.
5. Bake 50–55 minutes until the filling is bubbling and the topping is golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.
